Top 10 Project Risks

R001HIGH

Poor Data Quality

Description: Source data has significant quality issues requiring extensive cleansing

Impact: 5-10 day delay, reduced accuracy

Mitigation: Early quality assessment, automated validation, request clean data from source

Owner: Data Analyst

R002HIGH

Scope Creep

Description: Additional requirements added mid-project

Impact: 20-30% timeline increase

Mitigation: Clear scope document, change control process, stakeholder sign-off

Owner: Project Manager

R003MEDIUM

Key Resource Unavailability

Description: SME or technical resource not available when needed

Impact: 2-3 day delay per occurrence

Mitigation: Backup resources identified, knowledge documentation, early scheduling

Owner: Project Manager

R004MEDIUM

System Access Delays

Description: Delays in obtaining necessary system access

Impact: 1-5 day delay

Mitigation: Request access early, escalation path defined

Owner: IT Lead

R005LOW

Technology Issues

Description: Power BI service outages or technical problems

Impact: 1 day delay

Mitigation: Backup tools available, local development option

Owner: Technical Lead

Risk Response Strategies

Avoid

Eliminate the risk by changing approach

  • Use proven technologies
  • Simplify requirements
  • Reduce scope

Mitigate

Reduce probability or impact

  • Add validation checks
  • Build in buffer time
  • Create backups

Transfer

Shift risk to third party

  • Outsource complex tasks
  • Purchase insurance
  • Use vendor support

Accept

Acknowledge and monitor

  • Document risk
  • Create contingency
  • Monitor triggers

Contingency Plans

üî¥ If: Major Data Quality Issues

Then:

  1. Immediately escalate to sponsor
  2. Request corrected data from source
  3. Implement manual corrections for critical vendors
  4. Adjust timeline by 5 days
  5. Consider phased delivery approach

üî¥ If: Power BI Service Outage

Then:

  1. Switch to local development
  2. Use Excel for interim reporting
  3. Delay publishing until service restored
  4. Communicate revised timeline

üü° If: Key SME Unavailable

Then:

  1. Engage backup SME
  2. Use documented category mappings
  3. Schedule review when available
  4. Proceed with automated categorization

Parallel Processing Specific Risks

üîÄ Communication Gaps Between Streams

Risk: Parallel teams working in silos, leading to misalignment

Mitigation: Daily 15-minute standups at 9 AM with all stream leads

Prevention: Shared project dashboard, real-time Slack channel

Risk Review Checklist

Early Warning Indicators

Data Quality

  • Completeness <95%
  • Duplicates >2%
  • Missing vendor IDs >5%

Timeline

  • Any phase >1 day behind
  • Resource availability <80%
  • Rework >10%

Stakeholder

  • Meeting attendance <75%
  • Decision delays >2 days
  • Scope change requests >2

Risk Management Principle: The cost of preventing a risk is always less than the cost of dealing with its impact. Invest in prevention!
